# acosd

> Compute the [arccosine][arccosine] in degree of a double-precision floating-point number.

<section class="usage">

## Usage

```javascript
var acosd = require( '@stdlib/math/base/special/acosd' );
var sqrt = require( '@stdlib/math/base/special/sqrt' );
```

#### acosd( x )

Computes the [arccosine][arccosine] (in degree) of a double-precision floating-point number.

```javascript
var v = acosd( 0.0 );
// returns 90.0

v = acosd( 0.5 );
// returns 59.99999999999999

v = acosd( sqrt(2) / 2 );
// returns 44.99999999999999

v = acosd( sqrt(3) / 2 );
// returns 30.000000000000004

v = acosd( NaN );
// returns NaN
```

The domain of `x` is restricted to `[-1,1]`. If `|x| > 1`, the function returns `NaN`.

```javascript
var v = acosd( -3.14 );
// returns NaN
```

</section>

<!-- /.usage -->

<section class="examples">

## Examples

<!-- eslint no-undef: "error" -->

```javascript
var linspace = require( '@stdlib/array/base/linspace' );

var x = linspace( -1.0, 1.0, 100 );

var i;
for ( i = 0; i < x.length; i++ ) {
    console.log( acosd( x[ i ] ) );
}
```

</section>

<!-- /.examples -->
